posts.post_content: Interesting sidenote: it looks like the Oracle text went out of its way to specifically NOT call it sacrifice. This is important, as The Abyss's destruction is a targeted effect, so if you control any creatures with Shroud or Indestructibility, they're safe. More hilarious is that your [Troll Ascetic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Troll Ascetic) would NOT be safe, since it's being targeted by something YOU control. This is the only situation I can think of where regular Shroud is better than troll-Shroud :-)
posts.html:
Interesting sidenote: it looks like the Oracle text went out of its way to specifically NOT call it sacrifice. This is important, as The Abyss's destruction is a targeted effect, so if you control any creatures with Shroud or Indestructibility, they're safe. More hilarious is that your Troll Ascetic would NOT be safe, since it's being targeted by something YOU control. This is the only situation I can think of where regular Shroud is better than troll-Shroud :-)

posts.post_content:
I have the Oracle rulings from 1995 and this card USED to force players to sacrifice a creature.  
The ruling was almost word-for-word the [Call to the Grave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Call to the Grave) wording.  
Back then, there was no consistency or defined term of "target".   
Wonder when they changed it...?
posts.html:
